website_summaries.verdict: A good choice for most adventurers that need an affordable pair of snowshoes, as they are made to withstand typical walks in the snow and are priced affordably.
pros: Value-priced snowshoes in several sizes that are perfect for novices or light snow walking, as they are made of lightweight aluminum with an ergonomic shape that's easy to maneuver
Limited lifetime warranty adds to this solid deal
cons: Not ideal for walking on ice or up steep inclines, as they lack traction
A few owners say the straps are a bit difficult to fasten

customer_reviews.title: They work every bit as good, and I like the bindings better
customer_reviews.text: They work every bit as good, and I like the bindings better, than another pair I bought locally and paid twice as much for. Absolutely no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Knight

customer_reviews.title: Perfect snow shoe for hiking trails
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are light weight and the price is very reasonable. The last pair I had lasted me at least 15 years and I paid about the same price. I am not sure whether I like the plastic buckles and wonder if they will last very long. My old pair had leather and cloth/belt that was easy to tighten and hold. That is the only reason I gave it 4 stars. So far they are working out great. We hike at least 3 to 5 miles at a time into the wilderness so need them to hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: I like 'em a lot
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine a year ago. I used them almost daily last Winter. I live in the snow belt of the U.P. of Michigan. Got over 300 inches of snow last season. It is Dec 6th and I've used them only about 10 times so far but I did have a minor problem. One of the rivets that hold some support things together pulled out. I replaced the missing rivet with two washers and a nut & screw and it is fixed. For the price & amount of use I put them through, they are a terrific bargain.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cushing

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for daily exercise over light trails
customer_reviews.text: During winter months I snow shoe 3 to 4 times a week instead of jogging. I needed some light snow shoes for outings on well trodden trails. This fit the bill perfectly. Another requirement I had was they needed to be very quick to put on and take off. Again, these were perfect for that. They are very easy and quick to deal with. I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Nose trimming dude

customer_reviews.title: Worth it..!
customer_reviews.text: Did a snowshoeing weekend in Banff AB, worked pretty good actually, added some studs to give em alittle more traction after reading reviews.. Broke fresh trail in several feet of deep snow for about a mile, no problem.. Gonna try to add some heel steps too now but worked as good as my GF $300 pair.. Definitely worth the $60..!
customer_reviews.author: ms poffenbarger

customer_reviews.title: Really nice snowshoes!!
customer_reviews.text: Took these snowshoes on a trip to northern Idaho and trekked in the snow for a week. The buckles for tightening/loosening the shoes is very effective and easy to use even when wearing thick gloves. They are very light but work well in heavy snow and can not think of anything bad to say about them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought these since they had good reviews and were fairly cheap compared to others. We wanted to use them on Sunday walks in the park. We had never used sowshoes before and were not sure how difficult it would be. We love them. Fitting the buckles was easy. We did that in our living room and then, once in the park, just had to put the foot in and tighten the clamp. This can be done with one hand and gloves on. Release is also a one-handed operation and very quick. Walking is very comfortable, since the foot is on a hinge and can turn easily, just like walking normally.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grzonka

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I have several pair of snowshoes but I wanted this smaller size for use on somewhat compacted park trails. They work well and stay put once set. I recommend and will buy again if need arises.
customer_reviews.author: David M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these snowshoes specifically for getting some exercise during NJ snow storms when my gym is closed. They arrived just in time for today's winter storm Stella, and I snowshoed my way to my local park 2 blocks away. Only did one 1.2 mile lap around the park due to the biting wind, and am very happy with my purchase! The snowshoes were easy to put on and adjust, and I look forward to burning more calories on snow days in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Crista Tiboldo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars - Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: We live within walking distance of a nature reserve and have wanted to enjoy the park in the winter as much as we do in the summer. These snowshoes have made walking the park so much more fun! We bought them rather late in the winter season - so I am sure we were the only people happy for a March snow storm! The last snow fall - we were one of the few in the park - breaking trail and walking up and down on groomed/ungroomed trails. Easy to get on and off. So far a great buy for our usage and purpose!
customer_reviews.author: PetiteFrog

customer_reviews.title: I'm really happy with them and love the latch lock mechanism however ...
customer_reviews.text: These things rock! I used them a few times this winter season (FINALLY) after having them in my closet for almost two years due to lack of snow. I'm really happy with them and love the latch lock mechanism however you can't put them too tight because the latches are plastic and can bend/wear. Overall I'm seriously happy with these shoes and would definitely buy them again for the value.
customer_reviews.author: BooBee

customer_reviews.title: Really really bad snowshoes.
customer_reviews.text: The binding is just held to the frame by a flimsy strap of flexible plastic, so the binding can move all around vis-a-vis the frame while you are hiking. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Hope they work as well for you as they do for me.
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for me. I just needed them to get around on our farm when snow is deep. Save a lot of shoveling! They fit fine over my muck boots (I wear men's 8 women's 10.) The buckles seem to do the job. I have not used them very long or hard.
customer_reviews.author: happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall not bad, except using in wet snow-the two cramps accumulate ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall not bad, except using in wet snow-the two cramps accumulate ice/compressed snow adding to the weight of the shoes. There was not much snow to use them w/in the return time frame (little over a month) & I would have returned them if I could have..
customer_reviews.author: landy w.

customer_reviews.title: these will do fine for me
customer_reviews.text: They work for hiking around in snow, and they are inexpensive. Someday I may do some crazy mountaineering, but as long as I'm just hiking in snow, these will do fine for me. I've hiked probably 30 miles so far in them, and am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like that the bag they come in has a mesh ...
customer_reviews.text: These snowshoes did the job and the bindings did not break. I like that the bag they come in has a mesh section, so the moisture from any melting snow can evaporate. They cost only twice as much as renting a pair, so I'll break even with just another hike in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: Fairly good. Need heel supports
customer_reviews.text: I have used them hiking in the snow a few times. They are fairly good. But I noticed that they don't have heel supports. That's the only thing I wish they will add in their later models.
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: I really like these. Nice ratchet straps
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. Nice ratchet straps. A good value. Glad I didn't get a more expensive brand with inferior straps. Comes with a nice bag too. Good flotation, for walking on that powder.
customer_reviews.author: Rosalyn Walker

customer_reviews.title: Snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: Bought these without knowing anything about them other then looking them up on line and when we gave them to them they had heard of them and were real happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: K Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: 20 inches of powder. They were easy to put on, take off (had chores to do around the property), and put back on again. We sunk down about 8-10 inches, but it was POWDER. They can only get better as we get a crust on the snow, and they're awesome already.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: A great set of snowshoes
customer_reviews.text: I've owned snowshoes before, and I used to buy the expensive ones, but these are just as good, but I'll see after a few years of use. High utility value. Happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Johannes H. Benink Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great find
customer_reviews.text: The purchase was made for my husband. He is happy with these snowshoes. They work as well as my $200 shoes from REI. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: juless

customer_reviews.title: I am 170 lbs and these were what the website recommended but I sank fairly deep into fresh powder
customer_reviews.text: Shoes worked well but I wish I would have gotten bigger size. I am 170 lbs and these were what the website recommended but I sank fairly deep into fresh powder. Also forget about going downhill with any control. You basically just ski
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Quality construction and easy to fit over your boots.
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I've never snowshoed in my life & thought I 'd try it. Got one afternoon in with nice snow, now waiting for snow to return. Quality construction and easy to fit over your boots.
customer_reviews.author: BJP

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love our snowshoes! Great quality product, packaging, storage bags and poles!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, work great --- I am a beginner, but used these with ease.
customer_reviews.author: BohDaddy

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have clicker bindings which is fine except the strap is too long and drag on the ground a little. Otherwise these are good shoes. These may be adjustable, I have only used them once. Overall, good shoes for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Rose

customer_reviews.title: Marching through knee deep snow with these bad boys will make you feel more man than Bear ...
customer_reviews.text: Marching through knee deep snow with these bad boys will make you feel more man than Bear Grills eating whale blubber in Antarctica. No complaints at all, I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Sarcinella

customer_reviews.title: My first time snowshoeing and these seemed to work great. Easy to put on and went great in ...
customer_reviews.text: My first time snowshoeing and these seemed to work great. Easy to put on and went great in the snow.
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Bag broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Snow shoes are made of quality material. The bag unfortunately is not and one of the straps broke the first time I put on the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Dario

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my girlfriend as a xmas gift and after ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my girlfriend as a xmas gift and after using them one time both shoes had plastic that broke. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fastners
customer_reviews.text: Broken Buckles, not a fan of replacing these. Temps weren’t even cold!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pairs- these were AWESOME for my husband & i to use. Carrying cases are fantastic to protect car after use.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bennet

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Love these! So much fun for winter hiking. Easy to use and comfoetable
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Heatherman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and well made. Easy on and off - great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Aggie's

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on for a fun walk in the snow
customer_reviews.text: I took my snowshoes out yesterday and they were great. They are easy to ratchet tight to your boot with an easily adjustable strap around the back. Very fun!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: look great! Seem well made and the carry bag is ...
customer_reviews.text: look great! Seem well made and the carry bag is a nice extra.
customer_reviews.author: R. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: They are easy to get on and off and so much lighter than my old pair.
customer_reviews.author: D. B.

customer_reviews.title: ... to use the snowshoes this winter and are quite happy with them
customer_reviews.text: Have had a few occassions to use the snowshoes this winter and are quite happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a little tedious.
customer_reviews.text: The work really well! Only slight negative are the tightening of bindings..a little tedious.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. From my perspective, they're well made and effective. I'm a casual snowshoe hiker though.
customer_reviews.author: James R Myers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like them very much, the bindings are really great and easy to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Kenesie

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have used multiple times in some very deep/heavy snow and always keep me going. Have used to Mt. Rainier even with no problems! Good product for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and very easy to adjust to fit; light weight and grips snow and ice great!
customer_reviews.author: Diane W Bauska

customer_reviews.title: Very good for causal use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for limited use getting around my large yard when the snow is high. This winter in New Englsnd the snow was high enough to make it very tiring to walk about. I am sure you can buy much better quality and functionality if your needs require it but for casual use these work quite well at keeping me on top of most types of snow. The bindings are easy to put on and fit securely
customer_reviews.author: Cheff Jeff

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: I don’t have anything to compare them to, since they are our first pair of snowshoes. Are as expected and work well.
customer_reviews.author: Teah

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great snow shoes-they were easy to put on and didn't fall off once during the trip.
customer_reviews.author: ronna strandlof

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: This product would work in a pinch, but I wouldn't use them for a hike into the wilderness. The rivets are low quality and the ratchet straps don't mesh properly. I ended up returning them after realizing the low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Aerozuk

customer_reviews.title: They worked great.
customer_reviews.text: First time user. Had no problem putting them on using my snow boots. They worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Huntington

customer_reviews.title: took them out of the box and wow better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I received my Chinooks today, took them out of the box and wow better than I expected. great construction and easy to put on. I went with my dogs for a walk through the woods . The walk like a dream .......I now love snowshoeing .... we have an old wooden pair and I was tired after 20 steps. with my chinooks I could walk for an hour easily. Cheers from snowy Eastern Canada
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and take off
customer_reviews.text: So far, these snowshoes have worked very well. Easy to put on and take off, once you get the hang of how the mechanism works.
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son lives these for walking in the mud !!!
customer_reviews.author: Trent P Loney

customer_reviews.title: They do the job without breaking the bank. No frills, but easy fasten. Great for recreation or work.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy, nothing to break, but functionally very effective at a great price. The strap fasteners were simple and effective. I use these shoes for hiking as well as cold weather work outside, and they take the wear well. The travel bag is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only wish we'd had enough snow this year to try them out!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Acosta

customer_reviews.title: The quality of the shoes is very good. They just don't work for me at all
customer_reviews.text: I weigh 195 lbs and was expecting this to be the right size. They don't provide the flotation I expected. The quality of the shoes is very good. They just don't work for me at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Do not like the way they fit. Toe strap wont stay put. Wish I wouldnt have bought.
customer_reviews.author: L. B.

customer_reviews.title: ... and only have used them a couple of times like the carrying case works as a back pack also ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had them long and only have used them a couple of times like the carrying case works as a back pack also if u need to carry them
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Pope

product_meta.title: Chinook Trekker Snowshoes, 25, 80004
product_meta.description: Trekker Series snowshoes provide great traction and comfort on packed snow and moderate terrains that are great for enjoying long winter months hiking through trails and forest. They are made of light weight and strong aluminum frame ergonomically designed to ensure comfortable and easy walks. They feature UV resistant polyethylene decking and bindings that are flexible up to -40F (- 40C), easy-to-use dual freeze-resistant ratchet bindings that are easy to adjust and give a secure fit even with gloves on, heel straps with quick release buckles that keep foot hold secure. The heavy duty aluminum crampons rotate freely to bite into snow and let the tails drop to shed snow and the heel crampons provide traction for heading down mild slopes. They include a carry bag with adjustable back pack straps, side handles, mesh ventilation window and Velcro pole carriers. These long lasting snowshoes carry a limited lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Light weight and strong aluminum frame features an ergonomic design to ensure comfortable and easy walks
UV resistant polyethylene decking, easy-to-use dual ratchet bindings and heel straps with quick release buckles
Heavy duty aluminum crampons, rotate freely to bite into snow; heel crampons provide traction for heading down mild slopes
Includes carry bag with back pack straps, side handles, mesh ventilation and Velcro pole carriers
Recommended load: 130-210 pounds (59-95 kg); measures 25 x 8.3 Inch (63 x 21 cm); weighs 4.3 pounds (1.95 kg)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
